Cultural insights from global offices In our recent survey across regional hubs, we found that emotional bonds between colleagues are increasingly perceived as normal, especially among younger teams. Observations from site visit — HR sensitivity note During my on-site assessment, I noticed several instances of unstructured, emotionally charged interactions between colleagues during designated work hours. These included prolonged one-on-one chats, shared personal items (like lunches or notebooks), and frequent use of pet names in casual conversation. While none of these actions are technically against policy, they suggest an erosion of professional boundaries that could trigger future HR concerns. In cultures where personal expression is high, these behaviors may seem benign — but in highly regulated environments, they carry risk. I recommend reinforcing training on emotional intelligence in workplace settings.
